answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Spirometry tests can help diagnose if your symptoms are due to asthma or not. If due to asthma, it may need dose adjustments. Inadequate oxygenation can produce symptoms of breathlessness, as the body tries in an effort to compensate for the decreased oxygen supply. The breathlessness could be due to cardiac or lung disorders. Certain systemic disorders like anemia, diabetes, vitamin deficiencies and thyroid disorders can cause these symptoms. Discuss these options with your doctor when you happen to meet him next time.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: I'm 18 years old and have been having some breathing issues for the 4 daysI am asthmatic i am on turbo haler steroid and a blue ventolin inhaler, I have tried taking these ( been using the blue one more to see if it makes a difference which it hasnt )I have been constantly feeling like i'm not getting enough oxygen. i feel like i have to take these really big breaths to feel like i'm getting enough air. I went to the out of hours doctor on Sunday night and she said everything was perfectly fine my chest oxygen levels,. She though maybe it was anxiety. I did discuss with her that I thought i had a STD ( which i got checked yesterday and i have been confirmed with a STD ) but yet i still tonight have breathing  problems, I mean could it be anxiety? I dont feel anxious about anything or is anxiety not noticeable? I dont know what to do it feels like i am gonna have this for a long time and doctors and nursers cant seem to find whats up. Can anyone help? Btw Yes i do smoke,
title: Asthma
